selected_quotes: Hooray! Another Utah dinosaur - the ~125 million year old dromaeosaur Yurgovuchia doellingi
Meet Yurgovuchia, a dromaeosaur (raptor) that lived in Utah ~125 million years ago, now
New Dromaeosaurids from the Lower Cretaceous of Utah, and the Evolution of the Dromaeosaurid Tail
This made me smile. More theropod images need house cats for scale!

citation.abstract: The Yellow Cat Member of the Cedar Mountain Formation (Early Cretaceous, Barremian?--Aptian) of Utah has yielded a rich theropod fauna, including the coelurosaur Nedcolbertia justinhofmanni, the therizinosauroid Falcarius utahensis, the troodontid Geminiraptor suarezarum, and the dromaeosaurid Utahraptor ostrommaysorum. Recent excavation has uncovered three new dromaeosaurid specimens. One specimen, which we designate the holotype of the new genus and species Yurgovuchia doellingi, is represented by a partial axial skeleton and a partial left pubis. A second specimen consists of a right pubis and a possibly associated radius. The third specimen consists of a tail skeleton that is unique among known Cedar Mountain dromaeosaurids.
citation.title: New Dromaeosaurids (Dinosauria: Theropoda) from the Lower Cretaceous of Utah, and the Evolution of the Dromaeosaurid Tail

wikipedia.title: Dromaeosaurinae
wikipedia.summary: Dromaeosaurinae is a subfamily of Dromaeosauridae. Most dromaeosaurines lived in what is now the US and Canada, (Dromaeosaurus, Utahraptor), as well as Mongolia, (Achillobator, Adasaurus), and possibly Denmark, (Dromaeosauroides), as well.

wikipedia.title: Microraptoria
wikipedia.summary: Microraptoria (Greek, μίκρος, mīkros: "small"; Latin, raptor: "one who seizes") is a clade of dromaeosaurid theropods.

wikipedia.title: Archaeopteryx
wikipedia.summary: Archaeopteryx, sometimes referred to by its German name ("original bird" or "first bird"), is a genus of early bird that is transitional between feathered dinosaurs and modern birds.

wikipedia.title: Dromaeosauridae
wikipedia.summary: Dromaeosauridae is a family of bird-like theropod dinosaurs. They were small- to medium-sized feathered carnivores that flourished in the Cretaceous Period.

wikipedia.title: Eudromaeosauria
wikipedia.summary: Eudromaeosauria ("true dromaeosaurs") is a subgroup of terrestrial dromaeosaurid theropod dinosaurs.

wikipedia.title: Yurgovuchia
wikipedia.summary: Yurgovuchia is an extinct genus of dromaeosaurid theropod dinosaur known from the Early Cretaceous (probably Barremian stage) of Utah.

wikipedia.title: 2012 in archosaur paleontology
wikipedia.summary: This article records new taxa of fossil archosaurs of every kind that have been described during the year 2012, as well as other significant discoveries and events related to paleontology of archosaurs that occurred in the year 2012.

wikipedia.title: Xiaotingia
wikipedia.summary: Xiaotingia is a genus of bird-like theropod dinosaur from early Late Jurassic deposits of western Liaoning, China, containing a single species, Xiaotingia zhengi.

wikipedia.title: Timeline of dromaeosaurid research
wikipedia.summary: This timeline of dromaeosaurid research is a chronological listing of events in the history of paleontology focused on the dromaeosaurids, a group of sickle-clawed, bird-like theropod dinosaurs including animals like Velociraptor.

wikipedia.title: Compsognathus
wikipedia.summary: Compsognathus (Greek kompsos/κομψός; "elegant", "refined" or "dainty", and gnathos/γνάθος; "jaw") is a genus of small, bipedal, carnivorous theropod dinosaurs.

wikipedia.title: Utahraptor
wikipedia.summary: Utahraptor (meaning "Utah's predator") is a genus of theropod dinosaurs. It contains a single species, Utahraptor ostrommaysorum, which is the largest known member of the family Dromaeosauridae.

wikipedia.title: Achillobator
wikipedia.summary: Achillobator is a dromaeosaurid theropod dinosaur that lived roughly 98 to 83 million years ago during the Late Cretaceous in what is now Mongolia, in Asia.

wikipedia.title: Microraptor
wikipedia.summary: Microraptor (Greek, μικρός, mīkros: "small"; Latin, raptor: "one who seizes") was a genus of small, four-winged paravian dinosaurs.
